data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.14.2 (cb82febafda0c8c199b9201ad274e25d9a76874e, 2017-07-19T23:34:09.706Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
Bookmarks|ale|0.15.2
bracket-pair-colorizer|Coe|0.10.7
vscode-eslint|dba|1.2.11
tslint|eg2|0.17.0
csharp|ms-|1.11.0
debugger-for-chrome|msj|3.1.7
vscode-icons|rob|7.12.0
cordova-tools|vsm|1.2.8

(1 theme extensions excluded)


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  Open brand new file with code
2.  The title of the tab will be italicized.
3.  Use the key combination to set the tab as "Keep Opened".  Ctrl + K + Enter
4.  Observe that the tab is not affected and the tab title is still in italics.

Tried to use this with extensions disabled like requested below and it works fine.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: No

data.title: Full path to currently opened file in caption
data.body: Please display full path to currently opened file in app caption (at the moment there is only file name). While working e.g. on few folders/branches of the same project it is easy to mistake files with the same name.

milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.15.0-insider (211ffdf184329179ddca9c1fe993f5f11f3c4dda, 2017-08-02T05:07:49.324Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.6.0
- Extensions: none
---

Verifying #19193

Steps to Reproduce:

1. `terminal.integrated.scrollback`: 10
2. Open new terminal with more than 10 visible lines
3. Remains blank
4. Reload
5. Opens fine
6. Make it show <= 10 lines in viewport
7. Close terminal and reopen
6. Opens fine

data.title: Typescript Server Error: 'configure' request failed with error
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.14.2
- OS Version: Windows 10.0.15063 Build 15063

Steps to Reproduce:

Run VSCode with Typescript settings:

```json
{
  "compileOnSave": false,
  "compilerOptions": {
    "outDir": "./dist/out-tsc",
    "baseUrl": "src",
    "sourceMap": true,
    "declaration": false,
    "moduleResolution": "node",
    "emitDecoratorMetadata": true,
    "experimentalDecorators": true,
    "allowJs": true,
    "target": "es5",
    "typeRoots": [
      "node_modules/@types"
    ],
    "lib": [
      "es2016",
      "dom"
    ]
  },
  "include": [
    "node_modules/@types"
  ]
}
```

Reproduces without extensions: Yes

Error:

data.title: Request: Allow switching activity bar to minimalist layout
data.body:
The activity bar is by default very wide, despite only providing a place for a few icons to click on. 

It would be nice if it was possible to switch the activity bar to some kind of a "minimalist mode", meaning that the width would shrink to accommodate the also scaled down (eg. 16×16) icons (Git, Explorer, Search...)

data.title: Characters don't repeat when `ApplePressAndHoldEnabled` is disabled for VSCode
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.14.2 (cb82febafda0c8c199b9201ad274e25d9a76874e, 2017-07-19T23:22:50.650Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.6.0
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
EditorConfig|Edi|0.9.4
material-icon-theme|PKi|2.0.11
code-settings-sync|Sha|2.8.2
path-intellisense|chr|1.4.2
vscode-eslint|dba|1.2.11
vscode-babel-coloring|dza|0.0.4
auto-close-tag|for|0.4.3
auto-rename-tag|for|0.0.14
vim|vsc|0.9.0

(2 theme extensions excluded)


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Disable `ApplePressAndHoldEnabled` for VSCode: `defaults write com.microsoft.VSCode ApplePressAndHoldEnabled -bool false` to turn off the press-and-hold character picker behaviour for VSCode only (I don't want to disable this behaviour globally, hence writing to VSCode's defaults).
2. Restart VSCode
3. Press and hold any key (except arrows). You’ll see the press-and-hold character picker appear.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

---

**Possibly related but not the same issue:** #31676, #19764 

I’ve seen lots of issues around the Vim plugin stating the writing the global `ApplePressAndHoldEnabled` boolean to `false` will enable key repeats in VSCode, and this is true. But since I use the press-and-hold character picker in other apps, I don't want to disable it globally. When writing this default to `false` just for VSCode, it doesn’t seem to respect it. Screenshot of my `com.microsoft.VSCode.plist` file to verify:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1713932/28877436-4509b2e6-7794-11e7-9539-8f4dfe51d5fa.png)

data.title: Context menu of custom tree view items opens twice and on wrong entry if accessed via keyboard
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.14.2 (cb82febafda0c8c199b9201ad274e25d9a76874e, 2017-07-19T23:34:09.706Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create/use an extension contributing a custom tree view which has context menu entries on elements.
2. Navigate through the entries via up/down keys of your keyboard.
3. Press the context menu button on your keyboard.
4. Observe that the highlight moved one entry downwards. Any action on the context menu is linked to the wrong item now.
5. Observe that after pressing Escape to dismiss the context menu, the context menu pops up again at a different place. Another Escape gets rid of it completely.

This behaviour is different to the main file explorer and is probably a bug or two.

data.title: Emmet 2.0:  Doesn't offer suggestion when nested text provided
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.15.0-insider (211ffdf184329179ddca9c1fe993f5f11f3c4dda, 2017-08-02T05:07:49.324Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.7.0
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
ng-template|Ang|0.1.4
code-settings-sync|Sha|2.8.2
sort-lines|Tyr|1.3.0
html-snippets|abu|0.1.0
Bookmarks|ale|0.15.2
project-manager|ale|0.18.1
path-intellisense|chr|1.4.2
vscode-eslint|dba|1.2.11
tslint|eg2|0.17.0
auto-rename-tag|for|0.0.14
Angular2|joh|2.4.0
ecdc|mit|0.10.3
HTMLHint|mka|0.3.3
vscode-autoprefixer|mrm|2.1.1
vscode-stylefmt|mrm|2.5.0
angular2-inline|nat|0.0.17
stylelint|shi|0.28.0
change-case|wma|1.0.0

(4 theme extensions excluded)


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Type a pattern such as `section#chartjs>h1{My Title}` (yes, I'm an Emmet fanatic)
2. Nothing is suggested, but if I run "expand suggestion" from the Command Palette it works as intended.

Not sure if this is an issue, per se, but since the "expand suggestion" command is mapped to `tab` and tab doesn't actually expand anything (you need to choose the menu item) perhaps the command should be remapped to another key-command?

data.title: Duplicated intellisense messages following Julia language server crash
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.1
- OS Version: Linux

When the julia-vscode language server plugin crashes and restarts intellisense messages from the server are duplicated.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Install the julia-vscode extension: https://github.com/JuliaEditorSupport/julia-vscode/releases/tag/v0.7.0-beta.2 (requires julia v0.6)
2. Open a file,  switch the language to Julia and enter `rand()`, hover over `rand`
![julia-vscode1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5861046/28875256-762394a6-7784-11e7-9756-47182edee7ae.png)
3. Simulate a crash by killing the language server (`ps -A |grep julia`, then `kill` _`pid`_)
4. wait for language server to restart and hover over `rand`
![julia-vscode2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5861046/28875296-9f61bf50-7784-11e7-9872-9d58e64bbf82.png)

There is no difference in the message sent from language server but the client duplicates the display results by n (the number of times the server has crashed). 

We get the same duplication for other displayed language server responses.

data.title: Format Document changes the cursor position.
data.body:
I have set it to format the document when ever I save the file. And I save the file constantly, sometimes just to format the document and other times out of muscle memory for no good reason. So It's annoying that it takes away the cursor from where I'm at each time it happens.

![format document](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11874914/28874347-c71e8da4-7791-11e7-87ac-644172986b63.gif)

data.title: Make Ctrl+Right/Left aka cursorWordEndLeft/Right treat multiple spaces as a "subword".
data.body:
Here is how Visual Studio does it, which I much prefer:
![visual studio](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11874914/28873293-55c981e4-778d-11e7-99dc-fdd8c6cdb7b2.gif)

And here is how it looks in VS Code:
![vs code](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11874914/28873295-57cf235e-778d-11e7-9440-07119902340a.gif)

Is there any possibility of changing this, so that if there is a huge blank space, it doesn't skip next word as well? but only the huge blank space? I often use it to set the cursor at the beginning of the next scope.

data.title: Remove prompt when there is only one build task
data.body: I only have one build task defined, but when I press Ctrl+Shift+B or "Run Build Task..." it prompts me to select from a list of one...

data.title: We should have a unique type for a root folder in the internal API
data.body: I saw @isidorn work on the configuration resolve service today and I propose that even for the internal APU we introduce a unique type for a root folder instead of passing it around as a URI. This makes it more clear what is required. It is like having a URI and not passing a string around.

data.title: Running 'code .' doesn't open folder if Code is already open
data.body:
<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: Version 1.14.2 (1.14.2)
- OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12.6

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Ensure VSCode is closed
2. Open Terminal and type `code .` - VSCode opens in the current working directory
3. Go back to terminal and `cd` into another directory. Type `code .`
    **Expected**: VSCode opens new window with current working directory loaded
    **Actual**: VSCode comes to foreground. No new windows open
4. Close current VSCode window but don't close app
5. `cd` into another directory. Enter `code .`
    **Expected**: VSCode opens new window with current working directory loaded
    **Actual**: VSCode comes to foreground. Blank untitled document is created

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

This is the same behaviour works in the expected way in SublimeText and Atom

data.title: Copy from terminal doesn't work [Windows/Insiders]

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Steps to Reproduce:

1. open the integrated terminal and have it output some text so that scrolling happens
2. scroll up a little and select some text (see screenshot1)
3. press ctrl+c
4. press ctrl+v

Screenshot1:
![copypaste1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/199648/28865591-b3b6fb8c-7770-11e7-95e9-68c7650695ae.gif)

What happens: terminal scrolls to the bottom and the text that was previously in the clipboard (here `that's not what I copied`) is pasted, instead of the one I just copied using ctrl+c

Now, if I don't end the selection (ie: release the left mouse button) before reaching the left side of the screen, it will work:

![copypaste2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/199648/28865599-b8bce0ba-7770-11e7-9549-fffeca4054cf.gif)

I am using the latest insider build (211ffdf) on Windows 10 (64bit).

I tried and could not reproduce the problem on a standard cmd prompt.

data.title: Add support for memory viewer and disassembly code
